testimony.name: Sabrina Lippman
stated_affiliations: Habitat for Humanity New York City and Westchester County
key_points: Strong support for the City of Yes proposal
Importance of affordable housing and home ownership
New York City's low homeownership rate compared to national average
Support for accessory dwelling units and district fixes
Support for missing middle housing through town center zoning and transit-oriented development
Proposal as a step towards building a more equitable and affordable New York

quotes_indicating_discussion.text: implementing a universal affordability preference to allow buildings to add at least 20% more housing if the additional homes are permanently affordable
quotes_indicating_discussion.reasoning: This quote directly mentions the Universal Affordability Preference and accurately describes its key feature of allowing additional housing if it's affordable, which aligns with the proposal's description.

quotes_indicating_discussion.text: enable and support the missing middle housing. Conducive to condo and cooperative development through town center zoning and transit oriented development.
quotes_indicating_discussion.reasoning: This quote explicitly mentions town center zoning as part of the proposal to support missing middle housing and condo/cooperative development, which aligns with the Town Center Zoning element of the City of Yes For Housing Opportunity proposal.

quotes_indicating_discussion.text: We at Habitat particularly want to emphasize strategies that will support homeowners and enable more homeownership opportunities to be created, including permitting accessory dwelling units and district fixes, This will provide more space for multigenerational families
quotes_indicating_discussion.reasoning: This quote directly mentions permitting accessory dwelling units as a strategy to support homeowners and provide space for multigenerational families, which aligns with the Accessory Dwelling Units (ADUs) element of the City of Yes For Housing Opportunity proposal.

quotes_indicating_discussion.text: enable and support the missing middle housing. Conducive to condo and cooperative development through town center zoning and transit oriented development.
quotes_indicating_discussion.reasoning: This quote explicitly mentions transit oriented development as part of the proposal to support missing middle housing and condo/cooperative development, which aligns with the Transit-Oriented Development element of the City of Yes For Housing Opportunity proposal.
